cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the north-west Caribbean, forecast to cross the NE Yucatan Saturday night, then track north-northwest over the central Gulf toward the north-western Gulf Coast (LA/TX vicinity) early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast near the Louisiana-Texas border (west of Plaquemines Parish)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Yucatan Peninsula, entire central Gulf of Mexico, and U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama (including Louisiana coastline).
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds by late Monday–Tuesday; gusty squalls possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Any surge threat will depend on eventual landfall west of the port; early guidance suggests minor to moderate surge (above 3 ft possible) along southeast Louisiana if the track shifts east.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could reach southeast Louisiana Tuesday–Wednesday with localized totals above 4 inches, creating flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado threat in outer rain bands; elevated seas and strong currents that could disrupt vessel traffic prior to landfall.
